itemDescription: British East India Company army officer

wikipedia_page.main: General Alexander Duncan (1780–1859) was a Scottish officer of the East India Company army in Bengal.

response: *Alexander Duncan (army officer) (1780–1859), East India Company officer
*Alexander Duncan (bishop) (1655–1733), Scottish Episcopal clergyman and bishop
*Alexander Duncan (police officer) (1888–1965), Scottish police officer and Chief Commissioner of Victoria Police (Australia), 1937–1954
*Alexander Duncan (doctor), British doctor who spent six years in a village high up in the Wakhan Corridor of north-eastern Afghanistan
Parker married in India, in 1830, Elizabeth Mary Duncan (died 1883), second daughter of General Alexander Duncan. They had five sons and four daughters. Their children included:

In 1837 Baker married Frances Gertrude Duncan, third daughter of Major-General Alexander Duncan, on 29 June 1837. They were married for 44 years, but had no children. On 27 February the following year Baker’s sister Josephine married Colonel John Colvin in Ludlow, Shropshire.
Around 1850 the house was bought by General Alexander Duncan HEICS.

In February 1771, he married Elizabeth Knox, who bore him twelve children. His eldest son, Andrew, also became a professor at Edinburgh. His third son, Alexander Duncan (1780–1859), became a general in the army and distinguished himself in India.
